articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian man jailed in February for burning the Koran has been charged with treason by prosecutors who accuse him of passing video footage of military movements to Ukraine.
articles.title: Russian man jailed for burning Koran charged with treason

articles.author: Renee Maltezou, Jonathan Saul
articles.description: On a warm spring night in Athens, shortly before midnight, a senior executive at a Greek shipping company noticed an unusual email had landed in his personal inbox.
articles.title: Houthis warn shipowners in new phase of Red Sea campaign: Prepare to be attacked

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces launched a major drone attack overnight on 15 Ukrainian regions, causing damage to commercial and residential buildings, local authorities said on Thursday, though there were no immediate reports of any casualties.
articles.title: Russia launches major drone attack on Ukraine, damages residential buildings

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Gabriella Borter
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris plans to campaign with former Congresswoman Liz Cheney on Thursday in Wisconsin as the Democratic presidential candidate tries to court Republican and centrist voters in a battleground state for the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Harris woos Republican votes with Liz Cheney event, centrist moves

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh's interim government has recalled five envoys, including the ambassador to neighbouring India, in a major diplomatic reshuffle, a foreign ministry official said on Thursday.
articles.title: Bangladesh recalls five envoys in major diplomatic reshuffle

articles.author: Xinghui Kok
articles.description: A Singapore court on Thursday sentenced a former minister to 12 months in prison for obstructing justice and receiving more than $300,000 worth of gifts, in the first jailing of an ex-cabinet member in a city-state famous for its clean governance.
articles.title: Singapore's disgraced former minister S. Iswaran jailed in landmark case

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Fabian Hamacher, Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan on Thursday girded itself for the arrival of a weakening Typhoon Krathon which has killed two people so far, as the island shut down for a second day with hundreds of flights grounded and financial markets closed.
articles.title: Taiwan girds for weakening Typhoon Krathon, shuts down for second day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The EU Commission sued Spain, Cyprus, Poland and Portugal for failing to implement rules aimed at ensuring a global minimum level of taxation for multinational companies, it said on Thursday.
articles.title: EU sues Spain, Cyprus, Poland, Portugal for failing to implement corporate tax

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Passengers were evacuated from a Ryanair flight at Brindisi in southern Italy shortly before takeoff on Thursday morning after fumes were seen outside of the plane.
articles.title: Passengers evacuated from Ryanair plane in Italy after fumes seen
